definition: protection; refuge; shelter

vocative singular tāta, plural tātā, a term of friendly address to one or more persons
such a person, a person like that (referring to someone previously described)

(one) who is like that, just so; the same; (one) who is unaffected, immovable (so usually commentaries); (possibly) like that buddha; ~ sometimes especially as an epithet or designation of a/the buddha

destroyed utterly (with no possibility of regrowth)

beating; striking the hands together, clapping; a percussion instrument

so long as; as far as; especially as correlative of yava(ṃ) (and yāvatā); yāva … tāva …; a as long as … so long …
yāva na … tāva (na) …, as long as not, until … so long …
na tāva …yāva na …, na tāva … yāva …, not … as long as (not), not … until …
tāva … yāva (na) …, so long … as long as, until …
with yāvakīvaṃ: so long
